alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Missoula and south central Lake Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 553 PM MDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm producing a landspout near St. Ignatius, or 28 miles north of Missoula, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ravalli, St. Ignatius and Arlee. This includes Highway 93 N between mile markers 17 and 23, and between mile markers 29 and 32. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is generally harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
